name: Cold War Canada in Comparative Contexts
description: A seminar on Cold War Canada that focuses on the early post-war era and examines Canadian events, developments, experience within a comparative North American context. Weekly readings are organized around a particular theme or themes, including the national insecurity state; reds, spies, and civil liberties; suburbia; and sexuality.Canadian Area
prerequisites: HISB41H3 and at least one other B- or C-level credit in History
